snippet: Some families are staying longer in public housing even when making a decent living, pushing the New York City Housing Authority to make hard choices.
abstract: Questions have been raised about whether New York City Housing Authority should begin to coax higher-earning residents of public housing to leave to make room for needier residents; audit by Housing Dept and Internal Development inspector general found that around 10,000 housing authority tenants in 2014 made more than income eligibility threshold for such apartments; issue points to challenge of fostering economic diversity in housing projects at time when affordable housing in city is in short supply.
lead_paragraph: Some families are staying longer in public housing even when making a decent living, pushing the New York City Housing Authority to make hard choices.

headline.main: As New York Rents Soar, Public Housing Becomes Lifelong Refuge
headline.print_headline: Higher Earners Find Refuge in Public Housing
